page.title: 01AN INTRODUCTION TO WEST HULL
page.content: THE BLOCK EXTENDS FROM THE WEST EDGE OF HULL, EAST TO WITHIN A KILOMETRE OF THE CITY CENTRE. IT IS BORDERED IN THE NORTH BY PRIVATE HOUSING, AND TO THE SOUTH BY THE HUMBER ESTUARY. THE POPULATION IS APPROXIMATELY 90,000. WEST HULL IS A MAJOR ROUTE FOR ROAD AND RAIL TRAFFIC HEADING WEST TO MOST PARTS OF THE COUNTRY. THE TOP 4 SQUARES ARE A MIXTURE OF RESIDENTIAL AND RECREATION LAND, WITH 4 KILOMETRES OF SHOPS LINING A MAIN E-W ROAD. THE MIDDLE 4 SQUARES ARE A MIXTURE OF VICTORIAN RENEWAL, LIGHT FACTORIES AND NEARLY 30% PARK AND PLAYING FIELD. THE BOTTOM 4 SQUARES ARE LARGELY ESTUARY AND DERELICT DOCK LAND. SPORT FACILITIES ARE A FEATURE. WITH PROFESSIONAL FOOTBALL AND RUGBY; A TOP RUGBY UNION TEAM AND A SPECIALIST IN AND OUTDOOR ATHLETICS CENTRE
